relations.target: term=01031675-v (name formally or designate with a term);04420858-n ((architecture) a statue or a human bust or an animal carved out of the top of a square pillar; originally used as a boundary marker in ancient Rome);05864488-n (any distinct quantity contained in a polynomial; \""the general term of an algebraic equation of the n-th degree\"");06314878-n (a word or expression used for some particular thing; \""he learned many medical terms\"");06764688-n (one of the substantive phrases in a logical proposition; \""the major term of a syllogism must occur twice\"");06783666-n ((usually plural) a statement of what is required as part of an agreement; \""the contract set out the conditions of the lease\""; \""the terms of the treaty were generous\"");15249282-n (a limited period of time; \""a prison term\""; \""he left school before the end of term\"");15251247-n (the end of gestation or point at which birth is imminent; \""a healthy baby born at full term\""

senses.definition: A short school holiday in the middle of the term.
